description: A pseudo-Latin form of French compassionné, past participle of compassionner (“feel sorry for”).

adjectives.description: compassionate (comparative more compassionate, superlative most compassionate)

entries.meaning: Having, feeling or showing compassion (to or toward someone).
examples: The Compassionate, the All-Compassionate (names given to God in Islam)

entries.meaning: Given to someone as an exception because of a family emergency or a death in their family.

verbs.description: compassionate (third-person singular simple present compassionates, present participle compassionating, simple past and past participle compassionated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To feel compassion (for someone or with regard to something); to regard (someone or something) with compassion.
